title: How to write the thesis sentence in an argumentative essay - Quora

response.answer_text: I am in favor of ____________ (proposal) because of Y1 _______________ and Y2 ____________ The proposal must be precise, and it should be an idea that hasn’t been discussed to death. The Ys are your arguments. The “I” is yourself but it also stands for the issue. After you write the thesis, then you discuss the issue, but DO NOT ARGUE — yet. Then tell why you are a good candidate to be discussing the subject. That’s known as ethos or, in modern terms, establishing your credibility. However, it’s sort of optional. Then discuss your proposal. DON’T ARGUE — yet. Just be precise. Think it through. Pretend you are presenting the proposal before some kind of governing board. Hypothetically, you need to answer all the questions they make-believe people will ask you. THEN discuss your arguments. 2–4 arguments is usually best. You need lots of facts. Just because you say something is true doesn’t mean it’s true. PROVE IT. Then wrap it up. I have taught writing to 20K to 30K students, btw.
